intro: Coryzadenia, commonly known as the sticky coryzadenia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Coryzadenia species are known for their sticky secretions, which may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. These plants are of interest to botanists due to their unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
